reviews.text:
Recently modernised train station with two platforms - 

when the ticket office is open there is a waiting area, vending machines and the usual display boards

Trains that I have been on (with out any disruptions) have been busy

Within easy access of the shopping centre and this is well marked

Some buses do stop outside the bus station

Dreadful place. Road layout for the exit is madness around rush hour, staff don't seem to know a great deal or offer any help. The facilities are disgusting, litter everywhere. They added a modern bridge for people to walk over but the locals keep smashing it up so that was pointless. Your better off using a different station!

Nice station, new bridge keeps having glass cracked on it. Trains are unreliable but that's an train problem not station. They have sheltered areas for waiting but I tend to find the one on platform 2 rarely open.

I went inside the ticket office while I was on holiday, so I won't have much to say. Anyway, the station has a bad train service. I mean, i'm from London and i'm used to seeing trains pull in every 5 minutes, not nearly every 55 minutes! I really don't understand this because not only does it serve a large town, but is also within easy reach of Birmingham! Why the poor service?!
Recently rebuilt train station with everything you could need including a large (paid for) car park and hotel (Premier Inn). There is easy pedestrian access to the shopping area too.
